svg.text: Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim
Beiko . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Testing continues on
devnet-8 and MEV-Boost workflows on kurtosis Max epoch churn limit
(EIP7514) added to Dencun, the maximum new stakers per epoch will be set
to 8; Dankrad: EIP7514 gives time to deal with economic/tech
consequences of Lido attack BLOBBASEFEE opcode (EIP7516) for L2 fee
calculations added to Dencun EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM) being
updated with changes from audits Devnet-9 to include EIP7514, EIP7516
& EIP4788 changes, ACDC to set launch date Reth intro : EL client in
Rust, hoping to join devnet-9
* Testing continues on devnet-8 and MEV-Boost workflows on kurtosis
Testing continues on devnet-8 and MEV-Boost workflows on kurtosis
* Max epoch churn limit (EIP7514) added to Dencun, the maximum new
stakers per epoch will be set to 8; Dankrad: EIP7514 gives time to deal
with economic/tech consequences of Lido attack
Max epoch churn limit (EIP7514) added to Dencun, the maximum new stakers
per epoch will be set to 8; Dankrad: EIP7514 gives time to deal with
economic/tech consequences of Lido attack
* BLOBBASEFEE opcode (EIP7516) for L2 fee calculations added to Dencun
BLOBBASEFEE opcode (EIP7516) for L2 fee calculations added to Dencun
* EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM) being updated with changes from
audits
EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM) being updated with changes from
audits
* Devnet-9 to include EIP7514, EIP7516 & EIP4788 changes, ACDC to set
launch date
Devnet-9 to include EIP7514, EIP7516 & EIP4788 changes, ACDC to set
launch date
* Reth intro : EL client in Rust, hoping to join devnet-9
Reth intro : EL client in Rust, hoping to join devnet-9
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.3% has reduced slightly but still very close to
breaching risky 33% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.3% has reduced slightly but still very close to
breaching risky 33% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer:
Prysm over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain
split
Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
* Need more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes ,
particularly outside of US/Can/EU
Week in Ethereum News
